quoteFirst: The renewed attack started at 5 a. m., November 11th, advanced a short distance, but the troops had retired to cover in the face of reported heavy fire when the commander of the attacking Brigade received information at
quoteLast: that an armistice would be effective at 11 a. m. The Brigade Commander reports that he ordered all firing stopped by 10:45 a. m. and that the firing was so stopped.
title: My Colored Battalion
author: Ross, Warner A., 1879-

quoteFirst: Among other things, we noted the total eclipse of the sun on June 17. According to our time, it began in the evening at
quoteLast: and ended ten minutes after nine.
title: My attainment of the Pole
author: Cook, Frederick Albert, 1865-1940

quoteFirst: It will set as follows: On the 2d, at 9:10 a. m.; on the 16th, at 8:14 a. m.; and on the 29th, at
quoteLast: On the 13th, at 7:44 p. m., it will be 3° 18′ north of the moon. On the 29th can be found nearly on a line between _Beta_ and _Eta_ in the constellation _Virgo_, and from _Beta_ about one-third of the distance between these two stars.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, February 1884, No. 5.
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteLast: , still on bearing of 95 1/2 degrees; crossed sandy creek (dry) from north-east to east-south-east; at 9.52 crossed same creek still dry running to north of east; at 9.15 recrossed same; at 9.
